relatives and friends attended.

Minnie Lou Guyton discusses her promotion witt

Mrs. Guyon recepions the division building She

Suspended from classes 3days
are the seven Carl Hayden High
School students who were found
responsible for distribution on
campus of an unauthorized school
newspaper.


Harry E. White, principal, said
that on return to school the
students also will be required to
apologize to the student body in
an assembly.


The youths had written and
mimeographed a 23-page news
paper, ''Hayden Headlights"
which in satirical style was ctit-
ical of some student organiza-
tons. school administrators,
faculty, and policies.


Most offensive in the literary
effort, White said, was a poem
advising the Negro to "show the
bully (white many you too can
fight" The poem referred to the
Negro as "niggar."


White said the youths involved
we're ACCIDENTALLY good students,
talented and not discipline prob
lens. Their efforts at free ex-
PRESTON" he said. we're in poor
taste.

Ruby Lee Bates, AZ, was found
not guilty in Superior Court Of the
Aug. l6 gunshot Staying Of her
former boy friend. Josh Myles
Jr., As.


Prosecutor Robert Corcoran
argued during her trial on a
charge of murder undesignated,
that she hurled a bottle contain
ing hydrochloric acid at Myles
and then shot him when the pair
had a lovers quarrel in her
apartment at OLA w. Grant.


Defense attorney V. L. Hash
maintained Miss Bates shot
Myles in self-defense after the
victim violated the legal sane
tity of her home and threatened
her if she did not submit to his
advances.

Ruby Bates Freed
In Staying Trial
Of Boyfriend

PINE BLUFF. ARK. = Negro
comedian Dick Gregory and a
white civil rights organizer were
arrested when they refused to
leave a segregated restaurant.


The sheriff s office said they
were held in the county Jail.
"They could have made bond If
they had wanted to-" a deputy
said.


He said bond would be $500.


Gregory. whose home is in
Chicago, became widely known
for the barbs he hurled at seq
regaion In television and night
club appearances.


Arrested with him was VIII
liam Hansen, a field secretary
for the Student Nonviolent Co
ordinating Committee.

Dick Gregory


jailed For Sit In

TUCSON The Tucson Com
mission on Human Relations said
1t would ask more than 500, 900
Tucson families to sign voluntary
pledges of nondiscrimination In
housing.


The commi ssion siad the drive
has been approved by Catholic,
Protestant and Jewish leaders.


Under the pledge, families
would voluntarily welcome new
neighbors regardless Of race or
creed.

The Junior and Senior Missionary Circles of Union Baptist Church
hosted bridal shower for Miss Dolores Gordon.


Front includes Mrs. Opal Griffin Miss Ruby Brown, Miss
Lenora Gipson and Miss Daisy Demery.


Second Estalla Black Pee
honoree, and Mrs. Dolie Heard.


Third row-mes Lorena Minis Dorothy McCun Beverly Furch
Carolyn Carr, Christine Day and Rose Jackson.

Shiloh Baptist Church. 90l w.
Buckeye, Rev.S.T Miller. pastor.
Church groups will observe the
10th anniversary of founding Feb.

20-23. Rev. w. M. Harrison,
of Willow Grove Baptist Church,
will be speaker, Feb. %, 8 pm.

James l.. Davis, 1910 E. Mad
ison, hosted a birthday dinner

Sir Alexander Bustamane Prime Minister of jamaica displays
the Life Membership National Association for the Ad
Coored People, presented to him recently
by Field Secretary Colin Cromwell (second from righ
Mrs. Cromwell

Alpha Epsilon Sigma Chapter Phi Beta Sigma fraternity pre-
scented its Sweetheart Ball. Sat- Feb. 5 at Round
Up Room, Hotel Adams.


President the winner Miss Janee Smith,
Phoenix College who the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Her
Smith.


She received scholarship and US. savings bond.


left Misses Wilma Ecces Roberta
Ward.
